title: Nestorius becomes the Patriarch of Constantinople.
text: Nestorius becomes the Patriarch of Constantinople.

title: Halley's Comet makes its closest approach to Earth at a distance equal to 0.0342 AU (5.1 million kilometres/3.2 million miles).
text: Halley's Comet makes its closest approach to Earth at a distance equal to 0.0342 AU (5.1 million kilometres/3.2 million miles).

title: Deshin Shekpa, 5th Karmapa Lama visits the Ming dynasty capital at Nanjing. He is awarded the title "Great Treasure Prince of Dharma".
text: Deshin Shekpa, 5th Karmapa Lama visits the Ming dynasty capital at Nanjing. He is awarded the title "Great Treasure Prince of Dharma".

title: Ludovico Sforza is captured by Swiss troops at Novara and is handed over to the French.
text: Ludovico Sforza is captured by Swiss troops at Novara and is handed over to the French.

title: The Virginia Company of London is established by royal charter by James I of England with the purpose of establishing colonial settlements in North America.
text: The Virginia Company of London is established by royal charter by James I of England with the purpose of establishing colonial settlements in North America.

title: The Statute of Anne, the first law regulating copyright, comes into force in Great Britain.
text: The Statute of Anne, the first law regulating copyright, comes into force in Great Britain.

title: War of the Austrian Succession: Prussia gains control of Silesia at the Battle of Mollwitz.
text: War of the Austrian Succession: Prussia gains control of Silesia at the Battle of Mollwitz.

title: Napoleonic Wars: The War of the Fifth Coalition begins when forces of the Austrian Empire invade Bavaria.
text: Napoleonic Wars: The War of the Fifth Coalition begins when forces of the Austrian Empire invade Bavaria.

title: The Mount Tambora volcano begins a three-month-long eruption, lasting until July 15. The eruption ultimately kills 71,000 people and affects Earth's climate for the next two years.
text: The Mount Tambora volcano begins a three-month-long eruption, lasting until July 15. The eruption ultimately kills 71,000 people and affects Earth's climate for the next two years.

title: The Federal government of the United States approves the creation of the Second Bank of the United States.
text: The Federal government of the United States approves the creation of the Second Bank of the United States.

title: Patriarch Gregory V of Constantinople is hanged by the Ottoman government from the main gate of the Patriarchate and his body is thrown into the Bosphorus.
text: Patriarch Gregory V of Constantinople is hanged by the Ottoman government from the main gate of the Patriarchate and his body is thrown into the Bosphorus.

title: The 10,500 inhabitants of the Greek town of Missolonghi begin leaving the town after a year's siege by Turkish forces. Very few of them survive.
text: The 10,500 inhabitants of the Greek town of Missolonghi begin leaving the town after a year's siege by Turkish forces. Very few of them survive.

title: After the original Big Ben, a 14.5 tonnes (32,000 lb) bell for the Palace of Westminster, had cracked during testing, it is recast into the current 13.76 tonnes (30,300 lb) bell by Whitechapel Bell Foundry.
text: After the original Big Ben, a 14.5 tonnes (32,000 lb) bell for the Palace of Westminster, had cracked during testing, it is recast into the current 13.76 tonnes (30,300 lb) bell by Whitechapel Bell Foundry.

title: Archduke Maximilian of Habsburg is proclaimed emperor of Mexico during the French intervention in Mexico.
text: Archduke Maximilian of Habsburg is proclaimed emperor of Mexico during the French intervention in Mexico.

title: American Civil War: A day after his surrender to Union forces, Confederate General Robert E. Lee addresses his troops for the last time.
text: American Civil War: A day after his surrender to Union forces, Confederate General Robert E. Lee addresses his troops for the last time.

title: The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (ASPCA) is founded in New York City by Henry Bergh.
text: The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (ASPCA) is founded in New York City by Henry Bergh.

title: At Arogee in Abyssinia, British and Indian forces defeat an army of Emperor Tewodros II. While 700 Ethiopians are killed and many more injured, only two British/Indian troops die.
text: At Arogee in Abyssinia, British and Indian forces defeat an army of Emperor Tewodros II. While 700 Ethiopians are killed and many more injured, only two British/Indian troops die.

title: The first Arbor Day is celebrated in Nebraska.
text: The first Arbor Day is celebrated in Nebraska.

title: On Easter Sunday, Pope Leo XIII authorizes the establishment of the Catholic University of America.
text: On Easter Sunday, Pope Leo XIII authorizes the establishment of the Catholic University of America.

title: RMS Titanic sets sail from Southampton, England on her maiden and only voyage.
text: RMS Titanic sets sail from Southampton, England on her maiden and only voyage.

title: The Professional Golfers' Association of America (PGA) is created in New York City.
text: The Professional Golfers' Association of America (PGA) is created in New York City.

title: Mexican Revolution leader Emiliano Zapata is ambushed and shot dead by government forces in Morelos.
text: Mexican Revolution leader Emiliano Zapata is ambushed and shot dead by government forces in Morelos.

title: The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald is first published in New York City, by Charles Scribner's Sons.
text: The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald is first published in New York City, by Charles Scribner's Sons.

title: World War II: The Axis powers establish the Independent State of Croatia.
text: World War II: The Axis powers establish the Independent State of Croatia.

title: Rudolf Vrba and Alfréd Wetzler escape from Birkenau death camp.
text: Rudolf Vrba and Alfréd Wetzler escape from Birkenau death camp.

title: The Suez Canal is reopened for all shipping after being closed for three months.
text: The Suez Canal is reopened for all shipping after being closed for three months.

title: One hundred twenty-nine American sailors die when the submarine USS Thresher sinks at sea.
text: One hundred twenty-nine American sailors die when the submarine USS Thresher sinks at sea.

title: The TEV Wahine, a New Zealand ferry sinks in Wellington harbour due to a fierce storm- the strongest winds ever in Wellington. Out of the 734 people on board, fifty-three died.
text: The TEV Wahine, a New Zealand ferry sinks in Wellington harbour due to a fierce storm- the strongest winds ever in Wellington. Out of the 734 people on board, fifty-three died.

title: Paul McCartney announces that he is leaving The Beatles for personal and professional reasons.
text: Paul McCartney announces that he is leaving The Beatles for personal and professional reasons.

title: Ping-pong diplomacy: In an attempt to thaw relations with the United States, China hosts the U.S. table tennis team for a week-long visit.
text: Ping-pong diplomacy: In an attempt to thaw relations with the United States, China hosts the U.S. table tennis team for a week-long visit.

title: Tombs containing bamboo slips, among them Sun Tzu's Art of War and Sun Bin's lost military treatise, are accidentally discovered by construction workers in Shandong.
text: Tombs containing bamboo slips, among them Sun Tzu's Art of War and Sun Bin's lost military treatise, are accidentally discovered by construction workers in Shandong.

title: Vietnam War: For the first time since November 1967, American B-52 bombers reportedly begin bombing North Vietnam.
text: Vietnam War: For the first time since November 1967, American B-52 bombers reportedly begin bombing North Vietnam.

title: Invicta International Airlines Flight 435 crashes in a snowstorm on approach to Basel, Switzerland killing 108 people.
text: Invicta International Airlines Flight 435 crashes in a snowstorm on approach to Basel, Switzerland killing 108 people.

title: Red River Valley tornado outbreak: A tornado lands in Wichita Falls, Texas killing 42 people.
text: Red River Valley tornado outbreak: A tornado lands in Wichita Falls, Texas killing 42 people.

title: The Ojhri Camp explosion kills or injures more than 1,000 people in Rawalpindi and Islamabad.
text: The Ojhri Camp explosion kills or injures more than 1,000 people in Rawalpindi and Islamabad.

title: Italian ferry MS Moby Prince collides with an oil tanker in dense fog off Livorno, Italy killing 140.
text: Italian ferry MS Moby Prince collides with an oil tanker in dense fog off Livorno, Italy killing 140.

title: A rare tropical storm develops in the South Atlantic Ocean near Angola; the first to be documented by satellites.
text: A rare tropical storm develops in the South Atlantic Ocean near Angola; the first to be documented by satellites.

title: The Good Friday Agreement is signed in Northern Ireland.
text: The Good Friday Agreement is signed in Northern Ireland.

title: President of Fiji Ratu Josefa Iloilo announces the abrogation of the constitution and assumes all governance in the country, creating a constitutional crisis.
text: President of Fiji Ratu Josefa Iloilo announces the abrogation of the constitution and assumes all governance in the country, creating a constitutional crisis.

title: Polish Air Force Tu-154M crashes near Smolensk, Russia, killing 96 people, including Polish President Lech Kaczyński, his wife, and dozens of other senior officials and dignitaries.
text: Polish Air Force Tu-154M crashes near Smolensk, Russia, killing 96 people, including Polish President Lech Kaczyński, his wife, and dozens of other senior officials and dignitaries.

title: The Paravur temple accident in which a devastating fire caused by the explosion of firecrackers stored for Vishu, kills more than one hundred people out of the thousands gathered for seventh day of Bhadrakali worship.
text: The Paravur temple accident in which a devastating fire caused by the explosion of firecrackers stored for Vishu, kills more than one hundred people out of the thousands gathered for seventh day of Bhadrakali worship.

title: An earthquake, of 6.6 magnitude, strikes 39 km west-southwest of Ashkasham, shakes up India, Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Srinagar and Pakistan.
text: An earthquake, of 6.6 magnitude, strikes 39 km west-southwest of Ashkasham, shakes up India, Afghanistan, Tajikistan, Srinagar and Pakistan.
